p: A promising AChE inhibitory activity was observed also with Spanish S. rosmarinus essential oil with IC 50 values of 68.4 μg/mL [ 35]. The results are in accord with Mata et al. [ 36] who assessed the AChE inhibitory activity of rosemary essential oil from Portugal, finding an IC 50 of 69.8 μg/mL. Less activity was reported for Tunisian S. rosmarinus essential oil with inhibition percentage of 36.2% at concentration of 50 mg/mL against AChE [ 37]. Turkish S. rosmarinus essential oil was previously investigated by Orhan et al. [ 38]. An inhibitions’ percentage of 63.7 and 74% at concentration of 1 mg/mL, respectively for AChE and BChE enzymes, was observed.
